answers.answer: Hi,How are you?Since all the neurological causes are excluded. The dizziness that your grandmother is experiencing could be due to nutritional deficiency, high or low BP, dehydration, low blood sugar, poor eyesight and excessive fatigue.Does any of this sound familiar to you?
yes that makes a lot of sense she doesnt sleep well and we are currently looking into BP.Thank you so much-mike

Hi there,I am a nurse & working with older people I see alot of these symptions, Diabetes could be one raeson, Hypertensive, or even a UTI (dizziness) but the best thing to do is go back to the doctor again & explain that she is still having these symptoms again

question: She is 72 years of age and complains of often being tired, Dizzy, and a twitch in her eye we have visited the neurologist and he said she was fine but she still complains of these symptoms with her dizziness she often has to stop or sit because she fears falling please help.-Mike I
title: concerning my Grandmother
